bodydiv.p: Before an agenda decision is published, the Board is asked—at its first public meeting at which it is practicable to present the agenda decision—whether it objects to the agenda decision. Specifically, Board members are asked whether they object to (a) the Interpretations Committee’s decision that a standard-setting project should not be added to the work plan, and (b) the Interpretations Committee’s conclusion that the agenda decision does not add or change requirements in IFRS Standards. If four or more Board members object, the agenda decision is not published and the Board decides how to proceed.
